common_issues.title: Connection issues with Pieces OS from remote environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connection issues with Pieces OS from remote environments, such as Docker containers and VS Code remote instances. This is due to changes in the default listening interface of Pieces Server. Solutions include patching the VS Code plugin, creating custom DNS entries, and setting custom URLs in the plugin settings.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points:** * @malanciault reported an issue connecting to Pieces OS from a remote VSCode instance in a Docker container. * The default listening interface of Pieces Server changed to loopback in version 11.0.0, causing the connection problem. * Host.docker.internal resolution did not work with the Webview tool window. **Problems Identified:** * Networking changes in the latest major release caused connection issues from remote instances. * Listening on loopback interface by default prevented remote connections. * Host.docker.internal resolution caused Webview tool window issues. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Patching the VSCode plugin to allow listening on all interfaces. * Creating a custom DNS entry and adding it to /etc/hosts. * Setting a custom URL in the plugin to "http://pieceshost:39300". **Current Status/Outcome:** * Implemented solution: Patching the VSCode plugin to allow listening on all interfaces. * Issue resolved in Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2. **Additional Notes:** * @malanciault was offered a video call to troubleshoot the issue but opted for email communication instead. * The issue was resolved on January 14, 2025.

related_issues.title: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
related_issues.text:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
### Software

Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome browser slows to a crawl while hundreds of these errors are issued:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health   

Disabling the extension stops it, re-enabling invokes it again
## Key Points of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** User @SteveW555 reported an issue with the Chrome extension causing the developer console to fill with errors. This issue was potentially related to [#569](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/569).

**Resolution:** The issue was acknowledged and routed to the proper team member. 
- @rutvik-at-pieces stated the bug fix will be included in the upcoming extension release within the next 1-2 days.
- The issue was closed as a duplicate of [#562](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562) which describes the same problem.

**Current Status:** The problem is resolved and will be included in the next Chrome extension release.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Users (@laborer123, @AnkaYazilim1) experiencing issues with the tool.
* Potentially caused by invalid OpenAI API key or Claude/Gemini service issues.
* Suggested solutions: 
    * Remove OpenAI API key (@mark-at-pieces).
    * Switch to GPT4o model (@mark-at-pieces).
    * Update to version 11.0.3 and sign in to Pieces (@mark-at-pieces).
    * Remove OpenAI API key, but further investigation needed (@mark-at-pieces).

**Problems Identified:**

* Invalidation of OpenAI API keys.
* Potential issues with Claude and Gemini services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Removing OpenAI API key.
* Switching to GPT4o model.
* Updating to version 11.0.3 and signing in to Pieces.
* Removing OpenAI API key (temporary solution).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Some users report success with removing the OpenAI API key.
* Further investigation needed into the cause of API key failures and Claude/Gemini service issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* OpenAI API keys are not currently recommended for use with the tool.
* GPT4o model is suggested as a functioning alternative.
* Users experiencing issues are encouraged to provide feedback and report any further problems.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS causing high RAM/CPU usage, sometimes reaching 100%, leading to system slowdowns and unresponsiveness. This issue might be related to internet connectivity or specific features like Live Context. Temporary solutions include restarting PiecesOS or disabling resource-intensive features. The Pieces team is actively investigating and optimizing the software to resolve these performance issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

- Pieces OS, a centralized server for Pieces products, is experiencing high RAM and CPU usage.

**Problems identified:**

- High RAM usage (exceeding 2GB), even when not using the app.
- High CPU usage, causing system slowdowns.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- Optimizing memory usage by unloading ML models.
- Improving on-device ML performance to reduce resource consumption.

**Current status/outcome:**

- PiecesOS continues to have high resource usage, especially with Live Context enabled. 
- Users have stopped using Pieces due to resource concerns.
- The team is working on improvements, but no concrete timeline is available.

## Conciseness

- The summary highlights the key points, problems, solutions, and current status.
- The language is clear and avoids redundancy. 

## Focus on Important Details

The summary focuses on:

- The specific resources (RAM and CPU) affected. 
- The impact on user experience (system slowdowns and uninstallation).
- The current status and future improvements. 

**Note:** The user-provided screenshot is not reflected in this summary, as it is visual information.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* User reports context issues when using a specific file with Gemini 1.5, Flash, and GPT4o.
* The issue seems to be that the system returns responses indicating the file needs to be provided, even though it is included.
* Another user confirms the issue and reports additional problems with line numbers wrapping.

### Problems Identified:

* Context issues with specific file integration.
* Line number wrapping issue.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Investigation into the cause of the context issue is ongoing.
* The line number wrapping issue will be investigated by another user.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Both issues are being investigated and are expected to be resolved in the next patch.

## Additional Notes:

* The conversation indicates that multiple users are working on resolving the issues.
* The user is encouraged to check back for updates within the next 24 hours.

common_issues.title: Copilot Errors and Unresponsiveness
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot errors, unresponsiveness, and context issues across platforms. Suggested solutions include updating Pieces OS, removing OpenAI keys, switching to GPT4o model, and waiting for upcoming patches addressing specific bugs like line number wrapping and context integration.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@gittydia) reported an issue with Claude 3.5 not returning a Sonnet when expected.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces support team.
* Similar issues were identified and shared for reference.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claude 3.5 was not functioning as intended for specific commands.
* Users were encountering error messages like "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing..." in place of expected output.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the issue was identified and included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, scheduled for release no later than Thursday.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is expected to be implemented with the upcoming PiecesOS release.
* Users are requested to report back if the issue persists after the update.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided conversation lacks further updates beyond the proposed solution. 
* It is recommended to check back after the PiecesOS update or contact Pieces support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* User reports context issues when using a specific file with Gemini 1.5, Flash, and GPT4o.
* The issue seems to be that the system returns responses indicating the file needs to be provided, even though it is included.
* Another user confirms the issue and reports additional problems with line numbers wrapping.

### Problems Identified:

* Context issues with specific file integration.
* Line number wrapping issue.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Investigation into the cause of the context issue is ongoing.
* The line number wrapping issue will be investigated by another user.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Both issues are being investigated and are expected to be resolved in the next patch.

## Additional Notes:

* The conversation indicates that multiple users are working on resolving the issues.
* The user is encouraged to check back for updates within the next 24 hours.

recommendations: Investigate and address the root cause of connection issues with Pieces OS from remote environments, such as Docker containers and VS Code remote instances.
Optimize PiecesOS to reduce its RAM/CPU usage and address system slowdowns and unresponsiveness reported by users.
Investigate and resolve Copilot errors, unresponsiveness, and context issues across platforms, including those related to OpenAI keys, GPT models, and specific bugs like line number wrapping.
Prioritize resolution of high-activity tickets, particularly #550, #561, #586, and #585, to address user concerns and improve satisfaction.
Consider creating dedicated documentation or FAQs addressing common issues like remote connections and high resource usage to provide self-service support options for users.
Monitor the effectiveness of implemented solutions and communicate updates to users on bug fixes and upcoming releases to manage expectations and improve transparency.
